lecho.lib.hellocharts.computator

Class ChartComputator

  • java.lang.Object
    • lecho.lib.hellocharts.computator.ChartComputator
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    PreviewChartComputator 

    public class ChartComputator
extends java.lang.Object
    Computes raw points coordinates(in pixels), holds content area dimensions and chart viewport.

      Returns content rectangle with chart internal margins, for example for LineChart contentRectMinusAxesMargins is bigger than contentRectMinusAllMargins by point radius, thanks to that points are not cut on edges.

      • maxContentRect

        protected Rect maxContentRect

      • currentViewport

        protected Viewport currentViewport
        This rectangle represents the currently visible chart values ranges. The currently visible chart X values are from this rectangle's left to its right. The currently visible chart Y values are from this rectangle's top to its bottom.

      • maxViewport

        protected Viewport maxViewport

      • minViewportWidth

        protected float minViewportWidth

      • minViewportHeight

        protected float minViewportHeight

        protected ViewportChangeListener viewportChangeListener
        Warning! Viewport listener is disabled for all charts beside preview charts to avoid additional method calls during animations.

    • Method Detail

      • setContentRect

        public void setContentRect(int width,
                           int height,
                           int paddingLeft,
                           int paddingTop,
                           int paddingRight,
                           int paddingBottom)
        Calculates available width and height. Should be called when chart dimensions change. ContentRect is relative to chart view not the device's screen.

      • resetContentRect

        public void resetContentRect()

      • insetContentRect

        public void insetContentRect(int deltaLeft,
                             int deltaTop,
                             int deltaRight,
                             int deltaBottom)

        public void insetContentRectByInternalMargins(int deltaLeft,
                                              int deltaTop,
                                              int deltaRight,
                                              int deltaBottom)

      • constrainViewport

        public void constrainViewport(float left,
                              float top,
                              float right,
                              float bottom)
        Checks if new viewport doesn't exceed max available viewport.

      • setViewportTopLeft

        public void setViewportTopLeft(float left,
                               float top)
        Sets the current viewport (defined by currentViewport) to the given X and Y positions.

      • computeRawX

        public float computeRawX(float valueX)
        Translates chart value into raw pixel value. Returned value is absolute pixel X coordinate. If this method return 0 that means left most pixel of the screen.

      • computeRawY

        public float computeRawY(float valueY)
        Translates chart value into raw pixel value. Returned value is absolute pixel Y coordinate. If this method return 0 that means top most pixel of the screen.

      • computeRawDistanceX

        public float computeRawDistanceX(float distance)
        Translates viewport distance int pixel distance for X coordinates.

      • calculateRawDistanceY

        public float calculateRawDistanceY(float distance)
        Translates viewport distance int pixel distance for X coordinates.

      • rawPixelsToDataPoint

        public boolean rawPixelsToDataPoint(float x,
                                    float y,
                                    PointF dest)
        Finds the chart point (i.e. within the chart's domain and range) represented by the given pixel coordinates, if that pixel is within the chart region described by contentRectMinusAllMargins. If the point is found, the "dest" argument is set to the point and this function returns true. Otherwise, this function returns false and "dest" is unchanged.

      • computeScrollSurfaceSize

        public void computeScrollSurfaceSize(Point out)
        Computes the current scrollable surface size, in pixels. For example, if the entire chart area is visible, this is simply the current size of contentRectMinusAllMargins. If the chart is zoomed in 200% in both directions, the returned size will be twice as large horizontally and vertically.

      • isWithinContentRect

        public boolean isWithinContentRect(float x,
                                   float y,
                                   float precision)
        Check if given coordinates lies inside contentRectMinusAllMargins.

      • getContentRectMinusAllMargins

        public Rect getContentRectMinusAllMargins()
        Returns content rectangle in pixels.
        See Also:
        setContentRect(int, int, int, int, int, int)

      • getContentRectMinusAxesMargins

        public Rect getContentRectMinusAxesMargins()
        Returns content rectangle with chart internal margins, for example for LineChart contentRectMinusAxesMargins is bigger than contentRectMinusAllMargins by point radius, thanks to that points are not cut on edges.
        See Also:
        setContentRect(int, int, int, int, int, int)

      • getCurrentViewport

        public Viewport getCurrentViewport()
        Returns current chart viewport, returned object is mutable but should not be modified.
        Returns:

      • setCurrentViewport

        public void setCurrentViewport(Viewport viewport)
        Set current viewport to the same values as viewport passed in parameter. This method use deep copy so parameter can be safely modified later. Current viewport must be equal or smaller than maximum viewport.
        Parameters:
        viewport -

      • setCurrentViewport

        public void setCurrentViewport(float left,
                               float top,
                               float right,
                               float bottom)
        Set new values for curent viewport, that will change what part of chart is visible. Current viewport must be equal or smaller than maximum viewport.

      • getMaximumViewport

        public Viewport getMaximumViewport()
        Returns maximum viewport - values ranges extremes.

      • setMaxViewport

        public void setMaxViewport(Viewport maxViewport)
        Set maximum viewport to the same values as viewport passed in parameter. This method use deep copy so parameter can be safely modified later.
        Parameters:
        maxViewport -

                           float top,
                           float right,
                           float bottom)
        Set new values for maximum viewport, that will change what part of chart is visible.

        public Viewport getVisibleViewport()
